marketNews.title: Government Optimistic Loan Growth Accelerates to +10% YoY Following Liquidity Injection Realization
marketNews.content: Director General of the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Kacaribu, announced on Thursday (9/10) the realization of credit disbursement from a liquidity injection totaling 200 trillion rupiah placed by the government into the state-owned banks (Himbara) in September 2025. According to Ministry of Finance data, about 113 trillion rupiah or roughly 56% of the total funds have been disbursed. This makes the Ministry optimistic that industry-wide credit growth can reach +10% year-on-year by the end of 2025 (versus 8M25: +7.56% YoY), in line with the 2025 target that has been downgraded by Bank Indonesia to a range of +8-11% YoY. In general, Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded the highest disbursement rate of 74%, while Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) had the lowest disbursement rate of 19%. Both BMRI and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) aim to have all liquidity-injection funds disbursed before the end of 2025, while Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) targets the remaining funds to be disbursed no later than the end of October 2025. Febrio said that the majority of the liquidity-injection funds placed by Himbara are directed to the housing, construction, and agriculture sectors. Meanwhile, BBRI stated that it also channels funding to the plantation, trade, and industry sectors. BRIS announced that it will prioritize fund allocation to government programs such as the Red-White Village Cooperatives and Free Nutritious Meals, as well as financing for MSMEs and housing for non-civil servants. The interest that Himbara must pay on the government's own deposits will decrease from about 3.8% to 2% if the funds are channeled to the Red-White Village Cooperative program. Director of BBRI, Hery Gunardi, hopes the Ministry of Finance will increase fund placement at BBRI so the company can accelerate financing to productive sectors, given that credit disbursement to these sectors is relatively easy due to high demand. Meanwhile, Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa claimed that BMRI may also request additional fund placement to finance the property and automotive sectors. Recently, the government also plans to inject funds into regional development banks, with Purbaya stating that it will place funds into Bank Jakarta and East Java Regional Development Bank (BJTM) each around 5-10 trillion rupiah. Separately, Purbaya asked Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) to accelerate credit growth over the next two months, while warning that the government will withdraw fund placement from the bank if growth is deemed weak. Purbaya claimed that BBNI management targets credit growth above +11% YoY in 2026, higher than the 2025 guidance of +8-10% YoY.

marketNews.title: BIRD Exceeds Fleet Expansion Target in 2025
marketNews.content: Blue Bird ($BIRD) Chief Executive Officer Adrianto Djokosoetono told Kontan that the company added more than 1,500 new vehicles across its business lines during 8M25, surpassing the initial target of 1,200 units. By the end of 2024, BIRD had a total fleet of about 24,200 units, an increase of roughly 1,200 units compared to the previous year. Adrianto added that BIRD allocated a capex of 1.69 trillion rupiah for 2025, with absorption reaching 74% during 8M25. Bumi Resources ($BUMI) announced that the total transaction value to acquire 100% of Wolfram Limited, an Australian gold and copper mining company, is approximately 699 billion rupiah. The company has completed payment for 99.68% of Wolfram shares, with the remainder to be paid by the end of October 2025. CEO Adika Nuraga Bakrie said the transaction is a step toward diversification into strategic minerals. Previously, BUMI issued two tranches of bonds totaling about 1.07 trillion rupiah, with proceeds used for the Wolfram acquisition and related working capital. Krakatau Steel ($KRAS) stated in a clarification to the IDX that it is proposing a funding request from Danantara of US$500 million, to be partially met in the short term by a shareholder loan of US$250 million. The funds will be used for operational needs, including raw material purchases. KRAS also plans to seek an additional up to US$500 million in other forms for restructuring after reaching an agreement with banks. Management projects EBITDA could increase to US$31.9 million with Danantara financing. EM Tekno (EMTK), the controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media ($SCMA), bought about 257 million SCMA shares at an average price of roughly 400 rupiah per share between 30 September and 7 October 2025, for a total transaction value of about 102.8 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA rose from 67.20% to 67.55%. PT Multi Artha Pratama, the controlling shareholder of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua ($PANI), sold 178.2 million PANI shares at an average price of 14,075 rupiah per share on 9 October 2025, for a total transaction value of about 2.5 trillion rupiah, aiming to increase public ownership and liquidity. After the transaction, PT Multi Artha Pratama’s direct ownership in PANI fell from 88.84% to 87.78%. Raharja Energi Cepu ($RATU) said in a clarification to the IDX that it continues to study various financing and business development alternatives, including possible debt-like instruments, but no material corporate actions have been decided or disclosed to the public yet. Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI) announced it will conduct an audit for the 9M25 financial statements in connection with the company’s plan to obtain a global rating, and will release the 9M25 financial report no later than 28 November 2025.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content: Energy and Mineral Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said on Thursday (9/10) that the government plans to implement mandatory biodiesel B50 in the second half of 2026, pending test results. He also reaffirmed plans to launch mandatory E10 gasoline, with ethanol sourced from sugarcane or cassava. The International Copper Study Group (ICSG) now forecasts a refined copper deficit of 150,000 tonnes in 2026, revising down from a previously expected surplus. The revision reflects tighter supply due to force majeure at Freeport Indonesia’s Grasberg mine and disruptions in Chile and Congo, and a slowdown in copper production growth to +1.4% YoY in 2025 and +0.9% YoY in 2026. Bank Indonesia projects retail sales in September 2025 to grow +5.8% YoY, though month-on-month it is expected to contract -0.3%. In August 2025, retail sales rose +3.5% YoY and +0.6% MoM, outperforming BI’s forecast of +2.7% YoY and -0.3% MoM. The Indonesian Motorbike Industry Association (AISI) reported domestic motorcycle sales of 567,173 units in September 2025 (+7.3% YoY, -1.9% MoM), bringing 9M25 total to about 4.8 million units, roughly -0.7% YoY and 72-76% of the 2025 target. Bloomberg reported that Indonesia will halt imports of scrap metal until further notice to prevent further radioactive Caesium-137 contamination after a task force found traces in 22 factories in the Cikande Modern Industrial Area. The task force will initiate decontamination procedures with the National Nuclear Energy Agency. SBI Holdings bought approximately 1.04 billion shares of Bank Amar Indonesia ($AMAR) at an average price of 230 rupiah per share on 8 October 2025, for a total transaction value of about 238 billion rupiah, raising its ownership to roughly 5.64%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri records highest loan disbursement rate of 74% and seeks additional fund placement
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded the highest disbursement rate of 74% among Himbara banks. BMRI also targets to have all liquidity-injection funds disbursed before the end of 2025 and may request additional fund placement to finance the property and automotive sectors.

tickerNews.title: Bank Tabungan Negara reports lowest loan disbursement rate of 19%
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) had the lowest disbursement rate of 19% among Himbara banks.

tickerNews.title: Bank Syariah Indonesia prioritizes fund allocation to government programs and MSMEs
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) will prioritize fund allocation to government programs such as the Red-White Village Cooperatives and Free Nutritious Meals, as well as financing for MSMEs and housing for non-civil servants.

tickerNews.title: Bank Rakyat Indonesia targets remaining liquidity funds to be disbursed by end of October 2025 and seeks increased fund placement
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) targets the remaining liquidity funds to be disbursed no later than the end of October 2025. The bank also hopes the Ministry of Finance will increase fund placement at BBRI so it can accelerate financing to productive sectors.

tickerNews.title: Bank Negara Indonesia urged to accelerate credit growth, targeting >+11% YoY in 2026
tickerNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya asked Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) to accelerate credit growth over the next two months and warned that the government will withdraw fund placement if growth is weak. BBNI management targets credit growth above +11% YoY in 2026, higher than the 2025 guidance of +8-10% YoY.

tickerNews.title: Bank Jakarta and East Java Regional Development Bank receive 5-10 trillion rupiah each from liquidity injection
tickerNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya announced that the government will place funds into Bank Jakarta and East Java Regional Development Bank (BJTM) each around 5-10 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.content: Blue Bird (BIRD) Chief Executive Officer Adrianto Djokosoetono said the company added more than 1,500 new vehicles across its business lines during 8M25, surpassing the initial target of 1,200 units.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources acquires 100% of Wolfram Limited for approx 699 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources (BUMI) announced that the total transaction value to acquire 100% of Wolfram Limited, an Australian gold and copper mining company, is approximately 699 billion rupiah. The company has completed payment for 99.68% of Wolfram shares, with the remainder to be paid by the end of October 2025.

tickerNews.content: Krakatau Steel (KRAS) is proposing a funding request from Danantara of US$500 million, to be partially met in the short term by a shareholder loan of US$250 million. The funds will be used for operational needs, including raw material purchases. KRAS also plans to seek an additional up to US$500 million in other forms for restructuring after reaching an agreement with banks, projecting EBITDA could increase to US$31.9 million with Danantara financing.

tickerNews.title: EMTK increases stake in Surya Citra Media to 67.55% by purchasing 257 million shares
tickerNews.content: EMTK, the controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media (SCMA), bought about 257 million SCMA shares at an average price of roughly 400 rupiah per share between 30 September and 7 October 2025, for a total transaction value of about 102.8 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA rose from 67.20% to 67.55%.

After the transaction, PT Multi Artha Pratama’s direct ownership in PANI fell from 88.84% to 87.78%.
